channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Baby boomers have now ‘gobbled up’ nearly one-third of America’s wealth share, and they’re leaving Gen Z and millennials behind
item.description: American septuagenarians hold more than $85 trillion in assets—by far the most of any generation.

item.title: Where Agentic AI Helps Security — and Where It Still Falls Short
item.description: Agentic AI is reshaping cybersecurity workflows, giving overloaded security teams new support—when it’s deployed with clear guardrails, validation, an...

item.title: Open Source And Orchestration Will Define Enterprise AI Leadership In 2026
item.description: Red Hat and CrowdStrike say the real AI race is no longer about model performance alone, but about control and the orchestration required to exercise ...

item.title: Jared Kushner suddenly emerges in the Warner brawl between Paramount and Netflix, backed by Saudi billions and fresh off brokering another megadeal
item.description: Trump’s son-in-law is emerging as a central conduit for Gulf money moving into American media, and they’re backing the Ellisons and Paramount.

item.title: Forget The Perfect AI Model - Just Do It
item.description: How HHS’s AI framework can help healthcare CIOs cut through complexity, build practical governance, and finally start scaling AI in real workflows.

item.title: Parents are sacrificing retirement, taking second jobs, and liquidating investments just to afford college for their kids
item.description: More than 60% of parents say they’re delaying retirement to pay for college.

item.title: Building A One Person Unicorn? This Startup Just Raised $8.7M To Help
item.description: General Intelligence just raised $8.7M led by USV to build AI agents that run entire businesses - making the one-person, billion-dollar company possib...

item.title: ‘This isn’t what Walt and Roy would have wanted’: Disney fans with disabilities sue over new ride restrictions
item.description: Disney narrowed the scope to guests who “due to a developmental disability such as autism or similar” have difficulties waiting in a long line.

item.title: Fed expected to deliver third straight rate cut this week amid labor concerns
item.description: Fed policymakers face a tough decision on rates with inflation remaining above target as weak job market data and rising layoffs complicate the outloo...

item.title: Auto Industry Faces Continued Uncertainty Amid Trump Changes
item.description: The Trump administration says it's cutting back "EV mandates." An industry analyst said things are more complicated.

item.title: Bessent says US 'going to finish the year' with 3% GDP growth despite government shutdown
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent predicts the U.S. will finish 2025 with 3% GDP growth despite economic volatility from tariffs and immigration policy...

item.title: Paramount, Netflix spur Wall Street race to win jumbo loan deals
item.description: Loans of this size have been few and far between over the past couple of years amid subdued acquisition activity. But that’s all changed.

item.title: Young men are now banking on bitcoin more than their 401(k)s

item.description: The Commerce Department's delayed September PCE inflation report showed that inflation remained well above the Federal Reserve's 2% target ahead of a ...

item.title: US layoffs soar past 1.1M in 2025, highest level since the pandemic
item.description: November layoffs dropped 53% from last month but rose 24% yearly, pushing 2025 job cuts to levels not seen since COVID-19 pandemic struck the American...

item.title: Grand Canyon South Rim hotels forced to close due to water pipe breaks
item.description: Grand Canyon South Rim faces water emergency as broken pipeline forces hotel closures. Park remains open for day visits while water repairs continue.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
